paragraphs: Illinois Tech degree programs through Coursera — Online. In Demand.

Illinois Tech is excited to partner with Coursera to provide learners from throughout the world with future-focused, accredited, 100 percent online degree programs. Our industry-aligned programs taught by renowned Illinois Tech professors uniquely prepare students to be job-ready on day one. These are performance-based programs: begin your studies by completing three short courses with at least a B in each course, and you’ll be accepted to the program.
Illinois Tech offers the following degree programs through Coursera:
Start your journey today! Learnhow to get started today!
To learn more about upcoming sessions, view theCoursera Academic Calendar.
To learn more about upcoming courses, view theCoursera Course Offerings

Enroll today at the following Coursera Illinois Tech Program registration websites if you are 1) a new Performance Based Admissions (PBA) student, 2) a MOOC learner who wants to convert your MOOC certificate into an Illinois Tech degree, or 3) a current PBA student who needs to complete the rest of the PBA courses in your program.
GUIDE TO PBA REGISTRATION
PBA Student Checklist

Are you a MOOC learner taking any of the Illinois Tech Coursera courses? Did you know that your progress in the Illinois Tech Coursera online course you are enrolled in counts toward a degree? Checkthis webinar recording on MOOC to Degree with Illinois Techandthis slide deckto learn about the registration process.
If you have any questions on your PBA registration, email us atcoursera@illinoistech.edu
If you are a current student who has completed the Pathway courses, register at theIllinois Tech Portalwith your IIT login name and password.
Coursera Guide To Post PBA Registration
Post-PBA/ Degree Student Checklist
If you have any program specific questions, email us atMBA-support@illinoistech.edufor the MBA program andcc-support@illinoistech.edufor College of Computing programs (MDS, MIT, and BIT).

If you are having trouble linking your account, accessing your courses, or submitting your assignments in Coursera, please contact Coursera Learner Support atdegree-students@coursera.org. This is the quickest way for Illinois Tech degree students to resolve platform-specific technical issues.
Passcode: 0u1Y=kV%

Coursera
If my grades on Coursera are different from the grades on my transcript in Banner, what should I do?
When will I see my final grade on my transcript?
My degree dashboard in Coursera shows the course as “Completed,” but I got an E. What should I do?
What is “performance-based admissions (PBA)?”
What is the transfer credit policy?
Is there a way to evaluate my prior learning credit before I start PBA courses for the Bachelor of Information Technology?
I’m a current Illinois Tech student and I’m interested in transferring to one of the Coursera programs. How do I do that?
Can I be admitted to a Coursera-Illinois Tech program if I have been dismissed from Illinois Tech in the past?
Where do I submit my undergraduate transcripts?
Can I transfer credit from the professional industry certificate earned in Coursera to Illinois Tech degree programs?
I am currently enrolled in a Coursera-Illinois Tech program. Can I change to a different Coursera program?
Can I request a verification of student status?
How can I request an official transcript of Coursera-Illinois Tech courses?
Will my Illinois Tech Coursera degree and transcript say “Online” or “Coursera”?
How do I register for a course in any of the Coursera-Illinois Tech programs?
How can I get a PIN for registration at the Illinois Tech Portal?
I can’t see my courses in Coursera after registration. What should I do?
Can I take multiple courses at once?
I have completed PBA courses. What’s next?
How do I drop a course in the Coursera-Illinois Tech program?
Can I repeat a Coursera course?
How many courses can I register for per term?
How can I Register for an Illinois Tech MOOC Course?
I have been taking the Illinois Tech MOOC courses. How can I transfer to the Coursera-Illinois Tech program?
I cannot retrieve my password to login and enroll in PBA courses.
How can I validate that I am enrolled in the for-credit version of the course?
How can I view my grades?
Can I take time off from my program due to various reasons?
When can I access my courses in Coursera?
I cannot access Live Sessions or Office Hours via Zoom in my course. What should I do?
I am having trouble uploading my assignment in the course. What should I do?
I cannot access my assignment in Coursera. What should I do?
I find a quiz question incorrectly marked. What should I do?
How do I report a problem in the course such as a broken link or typos?
I am dealing with some issues affecting completion of my course. What can I do?
What is the tuition rate for Coursera-Illinois Tech programs?
What is the refund policy for dropped Coursera courses?
Do you offer any financial aid or scholarships for Coursera-Illinois Tech programs?
My company will sponsor my education. How can I register for the Illinois Tech Coursera courses?
Can I register for the Illinois Tech Coursera program with my VA education and training benefits?
I am interested in obtaining a professional certificate through Coursera. Is it possible to waive the associated fees?
Can I request an enrollment verification to use for employer tuition reimbursement?
How can I request a receipt for tuition paid for by employer tuition reimbursement?
Important Information About Loan Deferment for Coursera Students

I am a student with a disability who is taking Illinois Tech Coursera courses. Am I eligible for accommodations?
How can I get a Hawkcard/Campus ID?
How can I access Microsoft Office Product for free?
How long can I access my course after the course ends?
What kind of computer and software do I need to have for Coursera-Illinois Tech programs?

paragraphs: The discrepancy may be because of grade changes or system syncing errors. Please contact us via the program support email so that your instructor and TA can investigate and fix the issue as needed.

You should be able to see your final letter grades the day after the official grade submission deadline each term. You can find the final grade entry deadline information onthe Coursera Academic Calendar.

Completion status in Coursera only means you have submitted or viewed all course content. It does not guarantee a passing grade. Final grades on theIllinois Tech Portalreflect performance based on course requirements. If you think the final grade on the portal is not correct, please contact us via the program support email.

The performance-based admissions process prepares capable learners to start their next educational journey. You don’t need transcripts, tests, application fees, or other hurdles to begin taking classes. If you pass the initial “pathway courses” with a B or higher grade and fulfill program requirements, you will be automatically admitted to the program you have applied for.
Fulfillment of program requirements includes submission of transcripts prior to graduation.

All Bachelor of Information Technology students must submit official transcripts in order for the Office of Undergraduate Admission to evaluate your transfer course credits. Unofficial transcripts will not be accepted. Please have your previous institution send your transcripts toadmission@illinoistech.edufor review. Our office will evaluate your transfer credit within five business days after receiving your official transcripts.
What is the transfer policy for the Bachelor of IT program?

If you have a transcript from an international institution, you must provide: 1) course evaluations from a NACES- or AICE-accredited association, 2) course descriptions, and 3) certified English translations of your materials if they are in a language other than English. These documents must be submitted for all international transcripts before we can evaluate your transcript for course credit.

Transfer credit is not permitted for the three graduate-level programs, except for approved industry certificates (IPC) for two of our programs. More detailed information about the approved industry certificates can be found on theprofessional certificate information website.

Yes. If you are a domestic student, you can request a Pre-Enrollment transfer credit evaluation even before you enroll in the PBA courses by followingthe instructions on Pre-Enrollment Transfer Credit Evaluation. However, please note that this is not an official credit evaluation. You will need to request an official evaluation by submitting your official transcripts to the Office of Undergraduate Admission once you are admitted to the program.

Coursera programs are an exclusive arrangement and are not available to existing Illinois Tech students. Likewise, a student who wishes to transfer from a Coursera program to a non-Coursera program at Illinois Tech must reapply to the new program and meet all admission criteria. Transfer credit evaluation is done on a case-by-case basis and is not guaranteed.

Students who have been dismissed from Illinois Tech for academic, conduct, or other reasons will require approval from the Office of Academic Affairs and/or the Dean of Students Office, along with their intended program’s academic unit, before admission into a Coursera program.
If you are a master’s student and will be submitting your bachelor’s degree transcript, you may send it to grad.admission@illinoistech.edu, and by mail to:
Illinois Institute of TechnologyOffice of Graduate Admission10 West 33rd StreetPerlstein Hall, Room 203Chicago, Illinois 60616
Yes. You can transfer pre-approved industry certificates (IPC) for the Illinois Tech Coursera programs.

You will be able to apply three to six credits toward the degree. The number of prior learning credits is determined by each program. Credit for prior learning is awarded at the time of successful completion of performance-based admissions and formal acceptance into the degree program. More detailed information about the approved industry certificates can be found at each program website forMaster of Data Science,Master of Information Technology,Bachelor of Information TechnologyandMaster of Business Administration.
You can submit your transfer credit request with related certificates and documentation viaCredit for Prior Learning Request Formand send your inquiry topwolfe1@illinoistech.edu.

Yes, students who wish to switch from one Coursera program to another must submit a Coursera Change of Major form viathe Coursera Change of Major or Add Additional Major Request form link. If you change your major or add an additional major, you need to complete the new student orientation of the new program to access your courses of the new program in Coursera . If you do not find the new student orientation of the new program, please contact us viaCoursera@illinoistech.edu
Yes. You can visitthis linkto request enrollment and degree verifications. If you are a PBA student, you are considered non-degree until all PBA courses are completed with a grade of B or higher.
You can order official PDF transcripts electronicallyonlinewith your ID number.
No. Your Illinois Tech degree and transcript will not state "online" or "Coursera." They will be the same as those of Illinois Tech on-campus students.

If you are a new student or a MOOC learner who wants to convert your MOOC certificate into an Illinois Tech degree, or if you need to complete the Performance Based Admissions (PBA) courses, you can enroll today at the following Coursera Illinois Tech Program registration websites.

If you have completed the PBA courses and are ready to register for post-pathway or core degree courses, please login to theIllinois Tech Portal. Additional step-by-step instructions for non-PBA course registration can be found on ourwebsiteunder “Enroll in Coursera Courses.”

You will need a registration PIN in order to access the courses. For a master’s degree student, you will find your registration PIN in the QuickView section on the Welcome page in the Illinois Tech Portal. For a bachelor’s degree student, you will need to contact your advisor by submitting a case via email atcc-support@illinoistech.eduto receive an email with the PIN information.
This may be due to one of the following reasons:
Yes. You can register for as many courses as you’d like as long as it does not exceed thecredit hour limit per term.

Once you have completed your PBA courses successfully, your student status will be changed from a non-degree student to a conditionally-admitted degree-seeking student, and you will be considered a degree-seeking student. Once you have completed 9 (for GR) or 12 (for UG) credit hours, including the PBA courses, in Good Standing, you will be fully admitted to your program. Updates to student records should happen within approximately 2 weeks of receiving final grades.
You will be able to register for post-PBA and core degree courses within your program via theIllinois Tech Portal.
After checking theCoursera academic calendarto confirm the last day or drop a course, you have to complete one of the two processes below, depending on the course you need to drop:
Performance-based admissions courses
Post-performance-based admissions courses
You can find more information on the difference between withdrawing from vs. dropping a course atthe Office of the Registrar website.
Late Withdrawal

Withdrawals from courses after the published deadline are only permitted in extraordinary circumstances beyond a student's control, such as medical or personal emergencies, and must be accompanied with documentation related to the appeal. Appeals must be submitted after the withdrawal deadline noted in theCoursera Academic Calendarand before the final exam for the current term. Students are required to continue attending the course while the appeal is being reviewed.

In the rare event that a student has experienced circumstances beyond their control that might permit an exception to the university policy on course withdrawals, the student may submit theLate Withdrawal Appeal Formto the Office of the Registrar. Any documentation supporting the appeal should be included. Please note that requests for an exception will not be accepted more than one semester after the course in question. If you have any questions, please feel free to emailregistrar@illinoistech.edu.
For more information on post-PBA courses' registration and changes, please refer to theRegistration Changespage.

Students who enroll in Coursera’s performance-based admission (PBA) pathway courses can retake any of the three PBA courses one additional time—at cost—to improve their grades. For the first retake, there is no need for prior approval. The registration process is the same as for the original course.

PBA students will work through an academic appeal process in order to take PBA course(s) multiple times. They need to submit thegraduate student petition formfor their multiple PBA repeat requests. This process takes place with guidance from Illinois Tech’sAcademic Affairsoffice.
The first repeated PBA course is for a grade exclusion; any other approved repeated PBA course will then factor into a student’s grade-point average.

For non-PBA courses, please refer to the undergraduate course repeatpolicyand the graduate course repeatpolicy. The form to request an undergraduate course repeat can be foundonlineand the graduate form can also be foundonline.
Your course limit depends on whether you’re taking classes as a non-degree seeking student or if you’ve been officially admitted into a degree program.
Before you’re officially admitted (Non-Degree):
After you’re officially admitted (Degree):
If you’re looking to exceed these limits or are running into registration errors, here’s what you need to do:
MOOC is an acronym for Massive Open Online Courses. To enroll in an Illinois Tech MOOC course, you will need to do the following:
Once you complete the MOOC version of the course, you can apply your work to earn academic credit atIllinois Tech.
To receive credit towards degree completion for a MOOC course, you must:
*Some graded assignments such as Module Assessments may be longer and include graded activities that were not included in the MOOC version of the course.

To transfer from a MOOC learner to a credit student at Illinois Tech, you must register for the program via the Illinois TechCoursera Program Registration sitesup until the posted deadline in theCoursera Academic Calendar. You will need to pay the corresponding tuition. All completed required assignments in the MOOC will be transferred to the credit course, and you will be required to complete additional learning material and assessments in the credit version of the course to earn credit.
After transferring to the private course, review the checklist below to ensure you are aware of all the elements that are needed to successfully complete the course:
I cannot retrieve my password to log in and enroll in PBA courses.
Please contactsupportdesk@illinoistech.eduor use the Forgot Password function available on the login page.
You will access your for-credit degree courses through the Coursera-Illinois Tech degree homepage.

To ensure that you are in your for-credit degree courses, you mustlink your accountsand complete the new student orientation course. After your conversion from MOOC to for credit version of the course, you must complete additional learning materials and summative assessment to earn credit.
For PBA courses, you will see “For Credit” in front of the summative assessments.
To find your grades, you should navigate to the “Banner 9 - Self Service” app in your OKTA Dashboard atportal.iit.eduand then follow these directions:
You should then be able to view your grades.

Yes. Illinois Tech does not require Coursera students to enroll every term. While your adviser (who you will be assigned to once you are fully admitted to a program at Illinois Tech) should be informed of your intent, we do not require notification if you choose to take a term off.

You can access your courses in Coursera one week before each term officially starts. You can find the start date of each term on theCoursera Academic Calendar. If you are a new Illinois Tech Coursera student, you will need to link your account to your program and complete the new student orientation of your program in Coursera before you can access any courses you have registered for.

Make sure you are logged into Zoom through SSO using your university account. You can test the Zoom link ahead of time to avoid last-minute issues. If you still need any help with your access, contact us via the program support email for help. Here is 🔗Zoom Instructionsfor your reference. If you need immediate help, you can contact Coursera viathe learner support linkor chat once you log in for 24/7 support.

Check any required file formats for the assignment and make sure you are following the instructions exactly. You can also clear the cookies and caches of your browser or use a different browser. If you are unsure, contact us via the program support email to seek assistance. If you need immediate help, you can contact Coursera viathe learner support linkor chat once you log in for 24/7 support.

Some assignments may be locked until you complete a prior task. For example, every course summative assessment has the “Summative Course Assessment Acknowledgement” to complete in order to unlock it. Some assignments may have a certain window to access. Check if there is any prerequisite assignment to complete to access the assignment first. You can check the assignment deadlines as well. If everything looks completed and you are still stuck, contact the program support email for help.

If you think a quiz question is marked incorrectly, you can contact us via the program support email and request that your instructional team review the question. If the instructor confirms the error, the question and the quiz score will be updated accordingly.
If you spot an issue in the lecture material in your course, you have a couple of options:

If you have a substantial amount of equity in a course (e.g., 70% or more) but are unable to complete the course requirements by the end of the term due to extenuating circumstances such as illness or other unforeseeable circumstances, you may be able to request an incomplete (i) grade.

The incomplete (I) grade is temporary, and you must request in writing to the instructor using theIncomplete Grade Request Form. You need to submit it prior to the week of final examinations. Final exam dates can be found on theCoursera Academic calendar.
For more information about Illinois Tech's students' support such as Excused Absences, Medical Leaves, and Withdrawals, etc., you can checkThe Dean of Students Office website:FAQs.

Coursera tuition is set by program. Program tuition covers the required courses for the program, but it does not cover pathway courses that are repeated, failed attempts at credit by proficiency, additional courses needed to meet transfer credit requirements, or courses taken that are not required for the program. Full-program tuition is $18,000 for undergraduate-level programs and $15,000 for graduate programs. Costs will be divided by course and will be payable during the term that the course is taken. Illinois Tech reserves the right to reevaluate program tuition on an annual basis.

The deadline to request a refund is the same asthe add/drop date. Any courses removed after the last day to add or drop a course are subject to forfeiture of tuition. Fees for courses started via MOOC and that are completed via a credit by proficiency exam will not be refunded under any circumstances. You can find more information on the difference between withdrawing from vs. dropping a course atthe Office of the Registrar website.
For PBA courses, Requests for refunds due to a dropped course(s) are processed upon submission of theCoursera Course Drop/Withdraw Form.

No. Coursera Illinois Tech programs are not currently eligible for United States federal financial aid and there are currently no scholarships available. Illinois Tech encourages you to speak about tuition reimbursement through your employer.

You can register for the PBA courses via the Application and PBA Course Registration Form and the link will be provided after your eligibility is verified. For post-PBA courses which can be registered via theIllinois Tech Portal, you will need to submit a letter of sponsorship and billing information. More detailed information about the process can be found on theHow to Arrange Third-party Sponsored Billingwebsite (Sample Employer Sponsorship Letter)

Yes. Illinois Institute of Technology proudly processes United States Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) benefits for admitted veteran and active duty students. Veterans admitted to Illinois Tech are eligible to process the VA benefits listed below.
Students eligible for theMontgomery GI Bill®—either active duty (Chapter 30) or selected reserve (Chapter 1606)—

Chapter 35 Yellow Ribbon benefits cover the majority of the tuition expenses that an Illinois Tech student will have. Each year the VA sets a threshold for the maximum amount of tuition that the Post-9/11 GI Bill will cover. These rates can be found on theVA’s website. Once this amount is maximized, the Yellow Ribbon program and Illinois Tech will cover the remaining charges on your account for the term. Service members enrolled in the Post-9/11 GI Bill program can transfer unused education benefits to their spouses or children as of August 1, 2009. Families looking to apply forTEBmust visit themilConnect website.

Reserve Educational Assistance Program (REAP)is a United States Department of Defense education benefit program designed to provide educational assistance to members of the reserve components called or ordered to active duty in response to a war or national emergency (contingency operation) as declared by the president or Congress. This program makes certain reservists who were activated for at least 90 days after September 11, 2001, either eligible for education benefits or eligible for increased benefits.

Chapter 35Survivors of Dependents Assistance (DEA)provides education and training opportunities to eligible dependents of certain veterans. The program offers up to 45 months of education benefits. These benefits may be used for degree and certificate programs, apprenticeship, and on-the-job training. If you are a spouse, you may take a correspondence course. Remedial, deficiency, and refresher courses may be approved under certain circumstances.

TheVocational Readiness and Employmentprogram is a service for veterans who have a service-connected disability. Education and vocational counseling is available for eligible service members, current beneficiaries of GI Bill programs, and veterans and qualified dependents who are eligible for educational assistance under any of the GI Bill programs.
First-Time Applicants (New Students)
If you have not processed VA benefits at Illinois Tech before, please complete the following steps:
If you have any questions about processing your benefits, please email the Illinois Tech Office of the Registrar atregistrar@illinoistech.edu.

After a student has used benefits for their first semester, students will be certified automatically for proceeding semesters by the school certifying official unless the certifying official is notified otherwise.
If there is a semester that you do not want to process benefits, please email the Illinois Tech Office of the Registrar atregistrar@illinoistech.eduto request that your enrollment not be certified.

Unfortunately, fees cannot be automatically waived. However, you may be eligible for financial aid. Please refer to the screenshot for more information on how to apply. You can also find additional details about the financial aid application process inthis article.
Yes. The enrollment verification for the employer tuition reimbursement purpose for PBA students can be requested by submitting an email tocoursera@illinoistech.edu.
Receipts for tuition paid can be requested by submitting an email tocoursera@illinoistech.edu.
The entire loan deferment process is handled directly by you and your individual loan servicer to set the requirements and deadlines for deferment requests.
For Coursera Enrollment:The first term of your Coursera program taking PBA courses is considered non-degree seeking. Students who are non-degree seeking are not eligible for deferment at all.

Once your student status becomes degree-seeking after completion of three PBA courses successfully in your program, the university registrar will report your enrollment to a central database (National Clearinghouse) around the third week. If you're enrolled half-time or more, this reported status can trigger an in-school deferment for your loans.
What You Can Do:

No. As an online student and a student enrolled through Coursera, you are exempt from the university’s health insurance requirement and are not required to enroll in this health insurance plan. You will not be billed for this health insurance coverage.

Illinois Institute of Technology provides reasonable accommodations to degree students with disabilities with consultation from their academic programs. In order to receive accommodations for a disability, please contactthe Center for Disability Resourcesatdisabilities@illinoistech.eduor at 312.567.5744. You will need to submit documentation of your disability and speak with a staff member in the CDR to determine what accommodations are appropriate. Additional information about the CDR, services, and documentation guidelines can be foundon the CDR website:Disability Guidelines and Registration Forms. Advance planning is critical to ensuring that accommodations are provided in a timely manner.
If you are able to visit campus and would like an ID card to access the library, please complete the request form here:www.iit.edu/cbsc/campus-access/hawkcard/campus-identification
You will then be instructed to pick up the card on campus when it is ready.

As an Illinois Tech student, MS Office Product such as Word or Excel are freely available. You need to visitiit.okta.comand log in with your IIT credentials. After your login, you can find the MS 365 Portal icon and click it.
At the MS 365 Office Portal, find an install option on the right top corner.
If you have any trouble with the access and installation process, you can contactsupportdesk@illinoistech.edu.

Once the course ends, you will not be able to submit any activities, and the course will remain open for you to see your grade and feedback up to one week after the grades are posted. After that and in the future, you will see your grades and progress on theIllinois Tech Portal.

Access to Coursera courses is suspended one week after the grades are posted in the course to help maintain the academic integrity of the program and allow for regular maintenance of individual courses. You are advised to download any material you wish to keep before the last official day of class to avoid the loss of work or feedback.

You can check Coursera’s list ofrecommended browsers and devicesfor a general computer guideline. For courses specific skills and experience requirements, please check descriptions of the course before your registration.

Currently, Illinois Tech Coursera program courses do not utilize online proctoring services for online examinations. As a valued member of our academic community, you are expected to uphold the university's policies on academic integrity in all your coursework as outlined in theIllinois Tech Academic Honesty Guidelines. This includes completing your own work without unauthorized assistance and ensuring the integrity of the assessment process.

Violations of the academic integrity policy can result in serious consequences, as detailed in the university's official policy. These may include, but are not limited to, failing grades, suspension, or expulsion from the university.
Your student email account stays active for 12 months after graduation. After that, it can be forwarded to a personal email. You can find more details atAlumni Email Access
Which email to use for additional questions?
Please email us atCoursera@illinoistech.edu.
Which email to use for program specific questions?
Please email us atMBA-support@illinoistech.edufor MBA program questions and atCC-support@illinoistech.edufor College of Computing programs (MDS, MIT, and BIT) questions.
How can I contact for any technical issues with Coursera?
You can contact Coursera viathe learner support linkor chat once you log in for 24/7 support.
10 West 35th StreetChicago, IL 60616

Unlinked AccountIf you have already received the registration confirmation email after your registration for Coursera courses atthe Coursera-Illinois Tech registration pagewith the tuition payment, make sure that you havelinked your Coursera account to the degree program. This process can be found in the “Welcome” email from Illinois Tech. Once your account is linked, you will be redirected to the Degree Home Page on Coursera and you can find your registered course(s) there.
Processing TimeProcessing registration can take up to 36–48 hours. If your registration is completed within 24 hours, wait for another day to process your registration.

Incomplete Orientation CourseIf you still do not see your course after 36 hours, email us atCoursera@illinoistech.eduwith more details on your case with your registration confirmation email and tuition payment receipts.
Complete theCoursera Course Drop/Withdraw Formfor PBA courses and submit it.
Do not drop or withdraw PBA courses at theIllinois Tech Portalwhere the option to drop and withdraw is available. It willnotinitiate the refund process for the PBA courses.
The deadline to request a refund is the same as the add/drop date. Fees for courses started via MOOC and completed via a credit-by-proficiency exam willnotbe refunded under any circumstances.

Courses can be dropped in the same manner as you register for courses. After entering the PIN, your “Summary” will display all currently registered courses. You can select the “Drop Course” action from the drop-down menu for the course and click on the “Submit” button at theIllinois Tech Portal. For more information on dropping post-PBA courses, please refer to theRegistration Changespage.
Any courses removed after the last day to add or drop a course are subject to forfeiture of tuition.

To withdraw from a Post-PBA course, you need to visit theIllinois Tech Portaland perform the same process as adding or dropping a course. You may withdraw from one or more courses by the published withdrawal deadline, which can be found inthe Coursera Academic Calendar.
Master’s Programs:You can take up to 6 credit hours per term (that's a maximum of 12 credit hours per semester).
Bachelor’s Program:You can take up to 9 credit hours per term (with a maximum of 18 credit hours per semester).
You can take up to 9 credit hours per term (a maximum of 18 credit hours per semester).
Fill out a credit overload form:You can find this on theIllinois Tech Credit Hour Limits website.

Check with your advisor:They’ll need to give you approval before you can register for the extra courses. You can contact your program advisor by email or online office hours on theAdvising and Planning website.
Search for your Illinois Tech course
Select the Public version of the course
Complete the required Modules with at least an 80%
Enroll atthe Illinois Tech Coursera Program Registration sitesand pay tuition for the credit version of the MOOC course the next term it is available
Complete all assignments that did not transfer*including the for-credit summative assessments (final exams) with at least an 80%
Take part in both Office Hours and Live Sessions with the instructor of your respective course

Check your module summative assessment grades. Some grades may have carried over from the Public course and some may not have. If a module summative assessment grade did not carry over from your Public course, it may be due to one of the reasons below:
The assessment in the degree version may be entirely different from the Public version.
The assessment in the degree version may contain different questions in the assessment.

Review the course and identify whether there are any additional assignments, assessments, or discussions that are labeled as “for credit.” These are items that were not available in the Public course. You will need to complete these items.

Complete the summative course assessment. The summative course assessment is always different from the Public version, so you always need to take the summative course assessment after transferring to the degree course. For PBA courses, you will see “For Credit” in front of the summative assessments.
Click the Windows icon in the upper-left corner.
Item FeedbackUse the “Report an Issue” link at the bottom of any page to report content errors, broken links, or quiz issues.
Thumbs Up/DownClick 👍 if the content is helpful or 👎 if it’s confusing or outdated.
Discussion ForumsPost your concern or question to connect with peers and staff.
Email SupportStill need help? You can contact us via the program support email to report them. The instructional support team can check with the instructor to verify the issue and fix it.

Apply for VA benefits with the United States Department of Veterans Affairs (if you have already not done so) and obtain your certificate of eligibility. For more information on how to apply, please visit theDepartment of Veterans Affairs website
Send a digital copy of your certificate of eligibility via email to the Illinois Tech Office of the Registrar atregistrar@illinoistech.edu

Register for PBA courses via the Application and PBA Course Registration Form. The link will be provided after your eligibility is verified. This is important to avoid tuition charges at registration time.
Certifying VA benefits can take up to three weeks after the start of the term.
You are still responsible for the tuition if the VA benefit certification does not go through for any reason.
In case you reach out to your loan servicer directly for inquiry about the deferment process, they might requiredocumentation of your enrollment directly from the university.
Keep an eye on your enrollment status and communication from the university about reporting to the National Clearinghouse.

the instructions on Pre-Enrollment Transfer Credit Evaluation

pages.full_text:
Coursera Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
Home
Coursera
Coursera Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
More In This Section
Click to expose navigation links on mobile
Coursera
Academic Calendar
Advising and Planning
Course Offerings
Coursera Forms
Coursera Questions (FAQs)
Degree Student Guide
Degree Student QuickStart Checklist
Registration
Degree Planning
BIT
MBA
MDS
MIT
Commencement
Graduation
PBA Quick Start Guide
PBA Student Checklist
Admission and Student Record
If my grades on Coursera are different from the grades on my transcript in Banner, what should I do?
The discrepancy may be because of grade changes or system syncing errors. Please contact us via the program support email so that your instructor and TA can investigate and fix the issue as needed.
When will I see my final grade on my transcript?
You should be able to see your final letter grades the day after the official grade submission deadline each term. You can find the final grade entry deadline information on
the Coursera Academic Calendar
.
My degree dashboard in Coursera shows the course as “Completed,” but I got an E. What should I do?
Completion status in Coursera only means you have submitted or viewed all course content. It does not guarantee a passing grade. Final grades on the
Illinois Tech Portal
reflect performance based on course requirements. If you think the final grade on the portal is not correct, please contact us via the program support email.
What is “performance-based admissions (PBA)?”
The performance-based admissions process prepares capable learners to start their next educational journey. You don’t need transcripts, tests, application fees, or other hurdles to begin taking classes. If you pass the initial “pathway courses” with a B or higher grade and fulfill program requirements, you will be automatically admitted to the program you have applied for.
Fulfillment of program requirements includes submission of transcripts prior to graduation.
What is the transfer credit policy?
All Bachelor of Information Technology students must submit official transcripts in order for the Office of Undergraduate Admission to evaluate your transfer course credits. Unofficial transcripts will not be accepted. Please have your previous institution send your transcripts to
admission@illinoistech.edu
for review. Our office will evaluate your transfer credit within five business days after receiving your official transcripts.
What is the transfer policy for the Bachelor of IT program?
If you have a transcript from an international institution, you must provide: 1) course evaluations from a NACES- or AICE-accredited association, 2) course descriptions, and 3) certified English translations of your materials if they are in a language other than English. These documents must be submitted for all international transcripts before we can evaluate your transcript for course credit.
Transfer credit is not permitted for the three graduate-level programs, except for approved industry certificates (IPC) for two of our programs. More detailed information about the approved industry certificates can be found on the
professional certificate information website
.
Is there a way to evaluate my prior learning credit before I start PBA courses for the Bachelor of Information Technology?
Yes. If you are a domestic student, you can request a Pre-Enrollment transfer credit evaluation even before you enroll in the PBA courses by following
the instructions on Pre-Enrollment Transfer Credit Evaluation
. However, please note that this is not an official credit evaluation. You will need to request an official evaluation by submitting your official transcripts to the Office of Undergraduate Admission once you are admitted to the program.
I’m a current Illinois Tech student and I’m interested in transferring to one of the Coursera programs. How do I do that?
Coursera programs are an exclusive arrangement and are not available to existing Illinois Tech students. Likewise, a student who wishes to transfer from a Coursera program to a non-Coursera program at Illinois Tech must reapply to the new program and meet all admission criteria. Transfer credit evaluation is done on a case-by-case basis and is not guaranteed.
Can I be admitted to a Coursera-Illinois Tech program if I have been dismissed from Illinois Tech in the past?
Students who have been dismissed from Illinois Tech for academic, conduct, or other reasons will require approval from the Office of Academic Affairs and/or the Dean of Students Office, along with their intended program’s academic unit, before admission into a Coursera program.
Where do I submit my undergraduate transcripts?
If you are a master’s student and will be submitting your bachelor’s degree transcript, you may send it to grad.admission@illinoistech.edu, and by mail to:
Illinois Institute of Technology
Office of Graduate Admission
10 West 33rd Street
Perlstein Hall, Room 203
Chicago, Illinois 60616
Can I transfer credit from the professional industry certificate earned in Coursera to Illinois Tech degree programs?
Yes. You can transfer pre-approved industry certificates (IPC) for the Illinois Tech Coursera programs.
You will be able to apply three to six credits toward the degree. The number of prior learning credits is determined by each program. Credit for prior learning is awarded at the time of successful completion of performance-based admissions and formal acceptance into the degree program. More detailed information about the approved industry certificates can be found at each program website for
Master of Data Science
,
Master of Information Technology,
Bachelor of Information Technology
and
Master of Business Administration
.
You can submit your transfer credit request with related certificates and documentation via
Credit for Prior Learning Request Form
and send your inquiry to
pwolfe1@illinoistech.edu
.
I am currently enrolled in a Coursera-Illinois Tech program. Can I change to a different Coursera program?
Yes, students who wish to switch from one Coursera program to another must submit a Coursera Change of Major form via
the Coursera Change of Major or Add Additional Major Request form link
. If you change your major or add an additional major, you need to complete the new student orientation of the new program to access your courses of the new program in Coursera . If you do not find the new student orientation of the new program, please contact us via
Coursera@illinoistech.edu
Can I request a verification of student status?
Yes. You can visit
this link
to request enrollment and degree verifications. If you are a PBA student, you are considered non-degree until all PBA courses are completed with a grade of B or higher.
How can I request an official transcript of Coursera-Illinois Tech courses?
You can order official PDF transcripts electronically
online
with your ID number.
Will my Illinois Tech Coursera degree and transcript say “Online” or “Coursera”?
No. Your Illinois Tech degree and transcript will not state "online" or "Coursera." They will be the same as those of Illinois Tech on-campus students.
Registration
How do I register for a course in any of the Coursera-Illinois Tech programs?
If you are a new student or a MOOC learner who wants to convert your MOOC certificate into an Illinois Tech degree, or if you need to complete the Performance Based Admissions (PBA) courses, you can enroll today at the following Coursera Illinois Tech Program registration websites.
Master of Data Science
Master of Business Administration
Master of Information Technology
Bachelor of Information Technology
If you have completed the PBA courses and are ready to register for post-pathway or core degree courses, please login to the
Illinois Tech Portal
. Additional step-by-step instructions for non-PBA course registration can be found on our
website
under “Enroll in Coursera Courses.”
How can I get a PIN for registration at the Illinois Tech Portal?
You will need a registration PIN in order to access the courses. For a master’s degree student, you will find your registration PIN in the QuickView section on the Welcome page in the Illinois Tech Portal. For a bachelor’s degree student, you will need to contact your advisor by submitting a case via email at
cc-support@illinoistech.edu
to receive an email with the PIN information.
I can’t see my courses in Coursera after registration. What should I do?
This may be due to one of the following reasons:
Unlinked Account
If you have already received the registration confirmation email after your registration for Coursera courses at
the Coursera-Illinois Tech registration page
with the tuition payment, make sure that you have
linked your Coursera account to the degree program
. This process can be found in the “Welcome” email from Illinois Tech. Once your account is linked, you will be redirected to the Degree Home Page on Coursera and you can find your registered course(s) there.
Processing Time
Processing registration can take up to 36–48 hours. If your registration is completed within 24 hours, wait for another day to process your registration.
Incomplete Orientation Course
If you still do not see your course after 36 hours, email us at
Coursera@illinoistech.edu
with more details on your case with your registration confirmation email and tuition payment receipts.
Can I take multiple courses at once?
Yes. You can register for as many courses as you’d like as long as it does not exceed the
credit hour limit per term
.
I have completed PBA courses. What’s next?
Once you have completed your PBA courses successfully, your student status will be changed from a non-degree student to a conditionally-admitted degree-seeking student, and you will be considered a degree-seeking student. Once you have completed 9 (for GR) or 12 (for UG) credit hours, including the PBA courses, in Good Standing, you will be fully admitted to your program. Updates to student records should happen within approximately 2 weeks of receiving final grades.
You will be able to register for post-PBA and core degree courses within your program via the
Illinois Tech Portal
.
How do I drop a course in the Coursera-Illinois Tech program?
After checking the
Coursera academic calendar
to confirm the last day or drop a course, you have to complete one of the two processes below, depending on the course you need to drop:
Performance-based admissions courses
Complete the
Coursera Course Drop/Withdraw Form
for PBA courses and submit it.
Do not drop or withdraw PBA courses at the
Illinois Tech Portal
where the option to drop and withdraw is available. It will
not
initiate the refund process for the PBA courses.
The deadline to request a refund is the same as the add/drop date. Fees for courses started via MOOC and completed via a credit-by-proficiency exam will
not
be refunded under any circumstances.
Post-performance-based admissions courses
Courses can be dropped in the same manner as you register for courses. After entering the PIN, your “Summary” will display all currently registered courses. You can select the “Drop Course” action from the drop-down menu for the course and click on the “Submit” button at the
Illinois Tech Portal
. For more information on dropping post-PBA courses, please refer to the
Registration Changes
page.
Any courses removed after the last day to add or drop a course are subject to forfeiture of tuition.
To withdraw from a Post-PBA course, you need to visit the
Illinois Tech Portal
and perform the same process as adding or dropping a course. You may withdraw from one or more courses by the published withdrawal deadline, which can be found in
the Coursera Academic Calendar
.
You can find more information on the difference between withdrawing from vs. dropping a course at
the Office of the Registrar website
.
Late Withdrawal
Withdrawals from courses after the published deadline are only permitted in extraordinary circumstances beyond a student's control, such as medical or personal emergencies, and must be accompanied with documentation related to the appeal. Appeals must be submitted after the withdrawal deadline noted in the
Coursera Academic Calendar
and before the final exam for the current term. Students are required to continue attending the course while the appeal is being reviewed.
In the rare event that a student has experienced circumstances beyond their control that might permit an exception to the university policy on course withdrawals, the student may submit the
Late Withdrawal Appeal Form
to the Office of the Registrar. Any documentation supporting the appeal should be included. Please note that requests for an exception will not be accepted more than one semester after the course in question. If you have any questions, please feel free to email
registrar@illinoistech.edu
.
For more information on post-PBA courses' registration and changes, please refer to the
Registration Changes
page.
Can I repeat a Coursera course?
Students who enroll in Coursera’s performance-based admission (PBA) pathway courses can retake any of the three PBA courses one additional time—at cost—to improve their grades. For the first retake, there is no need for prior approval. The registration process is the same as for the original course.
PBA students will work through an academic appeal process in order to take PBA course(s) multiple times. They need to submit the
graduate student petition form
for their multiple PBA repeat requests. This process takes place with guidance from Illinois Tech’s
Academic Affairs
office.
The first repeated PBA course is for a grade exclusion; any other approved repeated PBA course will then factor into a student’s grade-point average.
For non-PBA courses, please refer to the undergraduate course repeat
policy
and the graduate course repeat
policy
. The form to request an undergraduate course repeat can be found
online
and the graduate form can also be found
online
.
How many courses can I register for per term?
Your course limit depends on whether you’re taking classes as a non-degree seeking student or if you’ve been officially admitted into a degree program.
Before you’re officially admitted (Non-Degree):
Master’s Programs:
You can take up to 6 credit hours per term (that's a maximum of 12 credit hours per semester).
Bachelor’s Program:
You can take up to 9 credit hours per term (with a maximum of 18 credit hours per semester).
After you’re officially admitted (Degree):
You can take up to 9 credit hours per term (a maximum of 18 credit hours per semester).
If you’re looking to exceed these limits or are running into registration errors, here’s what you need to do:
Fill out a credit overload form:
You can find this on the
Illinois Tech Credit Hour Limits website
.
Check with your advisor:
They’ll need to give you approval before you can register for the extra courses. You can contact your program advisor by email or online office hours on the
Advising and Planning website
.
How can I Register for an Illinois Tech MOOC Course?
MOOC is an acronym for Massive Open Online Courses. To enroll in an Illinois Tech MOOC course, you will need to do the following:
Go to
coursera.org
Search for your Illinois Tech course
Select the Public version of the course
Pay the course fee
Complete the required Modules with at least an 80%
Once you complete the MOOC version of the course, you can apply your work to earn academic credit at
Illinois Tech
.
To receive credit towards degree completion for a MOOC course, you must:
Enroll at
the Illinois Tech Coursera Program Registration sites
and pay tuition for the credit version of the MOOC course the next term it is available
Complete all assignments that did not transfer
*
including the for-credit summative assessments (final exams) with at least an 80%
Take part in both Office Hours and Live Sessions with the instructor of your respective course
*
Some graded assignments such as Module Assessments may be longer and include graded activities that were not included in the MOOC version of the course.
I have been taking the Illinois Tech MOOC courses. How can I transfer to the Coursera-Illinois Tech program?
To transfer from a MOOC learner to a credit student at Illinois Tech, you must register for the program via the Illinois Tech
Coursera Program Registration sites
up until the posted deadline in the
Coursera Academic Calendar
. You will need to pay the corresponding tuition. All completed required assignments in the MOOC will be transferred to the credit course, and you will be required to complete additional learning material and assessments in the credit version of the course to earn credit.
After transferring to the private course, review the checklist below to ensure you are aware of all the elements that are needed to successfully complete the course:
Check your module summative assessment grades. Some grades may have carried over from the Public course and some may not have. If a module summative assessment grade did not carry over from your Public course, it may be due to one of the reasons below:
The assessment in the degree version may be entirely different from the Public version.
The assessment in the degree version may contain different questions in the assessment.
Review the course and identify whether there are any additional assignments, assessments, or discussions that are labeled as “for credit.” These are items that were not available in the Public course. You will need to complete these items.
Complete the summative course assessment. The summative course assessment is always different from the Public version, so you always need to take the summative course assessment after transferring to the degree course. For PBA courses, you will see “For Credit” in front of the summative assessments.
I cannot retrieve my password to login and enroll in PBA courses.
I cannot retrieve my password to log in and enroll in PBA courses.
Please contact
supportdesk@illinoistech.edu
or use the Forgot Password function available on the login page.
How can I validate that I am enrolled in the for-credit version of the course?
You will access your for-credit degree courses through the Coursera-Illinois Tech degree homepage.
To ensure that you are in your for-credit degree courses, you must
link your accounts
and complete the new student orientation course. After your conversion from MOOC to for credit version of the course, you must complete additional learning materials and summative assessment to earn credit.
For PBA courses, you will see “For Credit” in front of the summative assessments.
How can I view my grades?
To find your grades, you should navigate to the “Banner 9 - Self Service” app in your OKTA Dashboard at
portal.iit.edu
and then follow these directions:
Click the Windows icon in the upper-left corner.
Click on “Banner.”
Click on "Student."
Click on “Record.”
Click on “Student Grade.”
Select term and course level.
You should then be able to view your grades.
Can I take time off from my program due to various reasons?
Yes. Illinois Tech does not require Coursera students to enroll every term. While your adviser (who you will be assigned to once you are fully admitted to a program at Illinois Tech) should be informed of your intent, we do not require notification if you choose to take a term off.
Coursera
When can I access my courses in Coursera?
You can access your courses in Coursera one week before each term officially starts. You can find the start date of each term on the
Coursera Academic Calendar
. If you are a new Illinois Tech Coursera student, you will need to link your account to your program and complete the new student orientation of your program in Coursera before you can access any courses you have registered for.
I cannot access Live Sessions or Office Hours via Zoom in my course. What should I do?
Make sure you are logged into Zoom through SSO using your university account. You can test the Zoom link ahead of time to avoid last-minute issues. If you still need any help with your access, contact us via the program support email for help. Here is 🔗
Zoom Instructions
for your reference. If you need immediate help, you can contact Coursera via
the learner support link
or chat once you log in for 24/7 support.
I am having trouble uploading my assignment in the course. What should I do?
Check any required file formats for the assignment and make sure you are following the instructions exactly. You can also clear the cookies and caches of your browser or use a different browser. If you are unsure, contact us via the program support email to seek assistance. If you need immediate help, you can contact Coursera via
the learner support link
or chat once you log in for 24/7 support.
I cannot access my assignment in Coursera. What should I do?
Some assignments may be locked until you complete a prior task. For example, every course summative assessment has the “Summative Course Assessment Acknowledgement” to complete in order to unlock it. Some assignments may have a certain window to access. Check if there is any prerequisite assignment to complete to access the assignment first. You can check the assignment deadlines as well. If everything looks completed and you are still stuck, contact the program support email for help.
I find a quiz question incorrectly marked. What should I do?
If you think a quiz question is marked incorrectly, you can contact us via the program support email and request that your instructional team review the question. If the instructor confirms the error, the question and the quiz score will be updated accordingly.
How do I report a problem in the course such as a broken link or typos?
If you spot an issue in the lecture material in your course, you have a couple of options:
Item Feedback
Use the “Report an Issue” link at the bottom of any page to report content errors, broken links, or quiz issues.
Thumbs Up/Down
Click 👍 if the content is helpful or 👎 if it’s confusing or outdated.
Discussion Forums
Post your concern or question to connect with peers and staff.
Email Support
Still need help? You can contact us via the program support email to report them. The instructional support team can check with the instructor to verify the issue and fix it.
I am dealing with some issues affecting completion of my course. What can I do?
If you have a substantial amount of equity in a course (e.g., 70% or more) but are unable to complete the course requirements by the end of the term due to extenuating circumstances such as illness or other unforeseeable circumstances, you may be able to request an incomplete (i) grade.
The incomplete (I) grade is temporary, and you must request in writing to the instructor using the
Incomplete Grade Request Form
. You need to submit it prior to the week of final examinations. Final exam dates can be found on the
Coursera Academic calendar
.
For more information about Illinois Tech's students' support such as Excused Absences, Medical Leaves, and Withdrawals, etc., you can check
The Dean of Students Office website
:
FAQs
.
Tuition and Payment
What is the tuition rate for Coursera-Illinois Tech programs?
Coursera tuition is set by program. Program tuition covers the required courses for the program, but it does not cover pathway courses that are repeated, failed attempts at credit by proficiency, additional courses needed to meet transfer credit requirements, or courses taken that are not required for the program. Full-program tuition is $18,000 for undergraduate-level programs and $15,000 for graduate programs. Costs will be divided by course and will be payable during the term that the course is taken. Illinois Tech reserves the right to reevaluate program tuition on an annual basis.
What is the refund policy for dropped Coursera courses?
The deadline to request a refund is the same as
the add/drop date
. Any courses removed after the last day to add or drop a course are subject to forfeiture of tuition. Fees for courses started via MOOC and that are completed via a credit by proficiency exam will not be refunded under any circumstances. You can find more information on the difference between withdrawing from vs. dropping a course at
the Office of the Registrar website
.
For PBA courses, Requests for refunds due to a dropped course(s) are processed upon submission of the
Coursera Course Drop/Withdraw Form.
Do you offer any financial aid or scholarships for Coursera-Illinois Tech programs?
No. Coursera Illinois Tech programs are not currently eligible for United States federal financial aid and there are currently no scholarships available. Illinois Tech encourages you to speak about tuition reimbursement through your employer.
My company will sponsor my education. How can I register for the Illinois Tech Coursera courses?
You can register for the PBA courses via the Application and PBA Course Registration Form and the link will be provided after your eligibility is verified. For post-PBA courses which can be registered via the
Illinois Tech Portal
, you will need to submit a letter of sponsorship and billing information. More detailed information about the process can be found on the
How to Arrange Third-party Sponsored Billing
website (
Sample Employer Sponsorship Letter
)
Can I register for the Illinois Tech Coursera program with my VA education and training benefits?
Yes. Illinois Institute of Technology proudly processes United States Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) benefits for admitted veteran and active duty students. Veterans admitted to Illinois Tech are eligible to process the VA benefits listed below.
Students eligible for the
Montgomery GI Bill®
—either active duty (Chapter 30) or selected reserve (Chapter 1606)—
Chapter 35 Yellow Ribbon benefits cover the majority of the tuition expenses that an Illinois Tech student will have. Each year the VA sets a threshold for the maximum amount of tuition that the Post-9/11 GI Bill will cover. These rates can be found on the
VA’s website
. Once this amount is maximized, the Yellow Ribbon program and Illinois Tech will cover the remaining charges on your account for the term. Service members enrolled in the Post-9/11 GI Bill program can transfer unused education benefits to their spouses or children as of August 1, 2009. Families looking to apply for
TEB
must visit the
milConnect website
.
Reserve Educational Assistance Program (REAP)
is a United States Department of Defense education benefit program designed to provide educational assistance to members of the reserve components called or ordered to active duty in response to a war or national emergency (contingency operation) as declared by the president or Congress. This program makes certain reservists who were activated for at least 90 days after September 11, 2001, either eligible for education benefits or eligible for increased benefits.
Chapter 35
Survivors of Dependents Assistance (DEA)
provides education and training opportunities to eligible dependents of certain veterans. The program offers up to 45 months of education benefits. These benefits may be used for degree and certificate programs, apprenticeship, and on-the-job training. If you are a spouse, you may take a correspondence course. Remedial, deficiency, and refresher courses may be approved under certain circumstances.
The
Vocational Readiness and Employment
program is a service for veterans who have a service-connected disability. Education and vocational counseling is available for eligible service members, current beneficiaries of GI Bill programs, and veterans and qualified dependents who are eligible for educational assistance under any of the GI Bill programs.
First-Time Applicants (New Students)
If you have not processed VA benefits at Illinois Tech before, please complete the following steps:
Apply for VA benefits with the United States Department of Veterans Affairs (if you have already not done so) and obtain your certificate of eligibility. For more information on how to apply, please visit the
Department of Veterans Affairs website
Send a digital copy of your certificate of eligibility via email to the Illinois Tech Office of the Registrar at
registrar@illinoistech.edu
Register for PBA courses via the Application and PBA Course Registration Form. The link will be provided after your eligibility is verified. This is important to avoid tuition charges at registration time.
Certifying VA benefits can take up to three weeks after the start of the term.
You are still responsible for the tuition if the VA benefit certification does not go through for any reason.
If you have any questions about processing your benefits, please email the Illinois Tech Office of the Registrar at
registrar@illinoistech.edu
.
After a student has used benefits for their first semester, students will be certified automatically for proceeding semesters by the school certifying official unless the certifying official is notified otherwise.
If there is a semester that you do not want to process benefits, please email the Illinois Tech Office of the Registrar at
registrar@illinoistech.edu
to request that your enrollment not be certified.
I am interested in obtaining a professional certificate through Coursera. Is it possible to waive the associated fees?
Unfortunately, fees cannot be automatically waived. However, you may be eligible for financial aid. Please refer to the screenshot for more information on how to apply. You can also find additional details about the financial aid application process in
this article
.
Can I request an enrollment verification to use for employer tuition reimbursement?
Yes. The enrollment verification for the employer tuition reimbursement purpose for PBA students can be requested by submitting an email to
coursera@illinoistech.edu
.
How can I request a receipt for tuition paid for by employer tuition reimbursement?
Receipts for tuition paid can be requested by submitting an email to
coursera@illinoistech.edu
.
Important Information About Loan Deferment for Coursera Students
The entire loan deferment process is handled directly by you and your individual loan servicer to set the requirements and deadlines for deferment requests.
For Coursera Enrollment:
The first term of your Coursera program taking PBA courses is considered non-degree seeking. Students who are non-degree seeking are not eligible for deferment at all.
Once your student status becomes degree-seeking after completion of three PBA courses successfully in your program, the university registrar will report your enrollment to a central database (National Clearinghouse) around the third week. If you're enrolled half-time or more, this reported status can trigger an in-school deferment for your loans.
What You Can Do:
In case you reach out to your loan servicer directly for inquiry about the deferment process, they might require
documentation of your enrollment directly from the university
.
Keep an eye on your enrollment status and communication from the university about reporting to the National Clearinghouse.
Illinois Tech Resources
I am enrolled in a Coursera program. Do I need to enroll in Illinois Tech’s health insurance plan?
No. As an online student and a student enrolled through Coursera, you are exempt from the university’s health insurance requirement and are not required to enroll in this health insurance plan. You will not be billed for this health insurance coverage.
I am a student with a disability who is taking Illinois Tech Coursera courses. Am I eligible for accommodations?
Illinois Institute of Technology provides reasonable accommodations to degree students with disabilities with consultation from their academic programs. In order to receive accommodations for a disability, please contact
the Center for Disability Resources
at
disabilities@illinoistech.edu
or at 312.567.5744. You will need to submit documentation of your disability and speak with a staff member in the CDR to determine what accommodations are appropriate. Additional information about the CDR, services, and documentation guidelines can be found
on the CDR website
:
Disability Guidelines and Registration Forms
. Advance planning is critical to ensuring that accommodations are provided in a timely manner.
How can I get a Hawkcard/Campus ID?
If you are able to visit campus and would like an ID card to access the library, please complete the request form here:
www.iit.edu/cbsc/campus-access/hawkcard/campus-identification
You will then be instructed to pick up the card on campus when it is ready.
How can I access Microsoft Office Product for free?
As an Illinois Tech student, MS Office Product such as Word or Excel are freely available. You need to visit
iit.okta.com
and log in with your IIT credentials. After your login, you can find the MS 365 Portal icon and click it.
At the MS 365 Office Portal, find an install option on the right top corner.
If you have any trouble with the access and installation process, you can contact
supportdesk@illinoistech.edu
.
How long can I access my course after the course ends?
Once the course ends, you will not be able to submit any activities, and the course will remain open for you to see your grade and feedback up to one week after the grades are posted. After that and in the future, you will see your grades and progress on the
Illinois Tech Portal
.
Access to Coursera courses is suspended one week after the grades are posted in the course to help maintain the academic integrity of the program and allow for regular maintenance of individual courses. You are advised to download any material you wish to keep before the last official day of class to avoid the loss of work or feedback.
What kind of computer and software do I need to have for Coursera-Illinois Tech programs?
You can check Coursera’s list of
recommended browsers and devices
for a general computer guideline. For courses specific skills and experience requirements, please check descriptions of the course before your registration.
Will my online exams be proctored?
Currently, Illinois Tech Coursera program courses do not utilize online proctoring services for online examinations. As a valued member of our academic community, you are expected to uphold the university's policies on academic integrity in all your coursework as outlined in the
Illinois Tech Academic Honesty Guidelines
. This includes completing your own work without unauthorized assistance and ensuring the integrity of the assessment process.
Violations of the academic integrity policy can result in serious consequences, as detailed in the university's official policy. These may include, but are not limited to, failing grades, suspension, or expulsion from the university.
How long can I access my Illinois Tech student email after I graduate?
Your student email account stays active for 12 months after graduation. After that, it can be forwarded to a personal email. You can find more details at
Alumni Email Access
Communication
Which email to use for additional questions?
Please email us at
Coursera@illinoistech.edu
.
Which email to use for program specific questions?
Please email us at
MBA-support@illinoistech.edu
for MBA program questions and at
CC-support@illinoistech.edu
for College of Computing programs (MDS, MIT, and BIT) questions.
How can I contact for any technical issues with Coursera?
You can contact Coursera via
the learner support link
or chat once you log in for 24/7 support.

paragraphs: In order to support our Illinois Tech Coursera students, our Coursera program advisers will provide guidance as you progress through the program. Meet your adviser!
Yumiko Saito

Yumiko Saito joined the Illinois Tech community as an academic adviser in September 2024. She provides academic advising support primarily to the Coursera M.B.A. students. She holds a B.A. in psychology and an M.A. in counseling from the University of Arizona. She has a strong background in behavioral health and worked as a mental health therapist with a diverse range of clients, which enriches her ability to provide holistic support to students from diverse backgrounds. She also has experience as an academic adviser for undergraduate students prior to joining Illinois Tech. In addition, Yumiko’s personal journey as an international student herself allows her to become a better advocate for students from various backgrounds and enhance their experience at Illinois Tech.
Dennis King

Dennis brings nearly 20 years of experience in student support, supplemental instruction, program development, management and supervision in public higher education. In addition to his student success leadership and administrative responsibilities, his journey as a practitioner in higher education is steeped in promoting academic excellence and ensuring equitable educational opportunities. As the adviser for College of Computing programs (Bachelor of IT, Master of IT, and Master of Data Science), Dennis will work to ensure that all CoC learners are provided quality advising services as they journey to reach their academic, personal, and professional goals.
Degree Works Tutorial
Degree Requirements
Degree Planning Worksheet Template
Current Illinois Tech Coursera students can meet with the program adviser in a 30-minute individual appointment.
Appointments are held between 8 a.m.–5 p.m. (CT).

You must contact your adviser using your Illinois Tech email account. You must send an email with your questions. Your academic adviser will respond to your email within 24–72 hours during business days.
10 West 35th StreetChicago, IL 60616

Introduction
In order to support our Illinois Tech Coursera students, our Coursera program advisers will provide guidance as you progress through the program. Meet your adviser!
M.B.A. Program Adviser
Yumiko Saito
Yumiko Saito joined the Illinois Tech community as an academic adviser in September 2024. She provides academic advising support primarily to the Coursera M.B.A. students. She holds a B.A. in psychology and an M.A. in counseling from the University of Arizona. She has a strong background in behavioral health and worked as a mental health therapist with a diverse range of clients, which enriches her ability to provide holistic support to students from diverse backgrounds. She also has experience as an academic adviser for undergraduate students prior to joining Illinois Tech. In addition, Yumiko’s personal journey as an international student herself allows her to become a better advocate for students from various backgrounds and enhance their experience at Illinois Tech.
College of Computing Program Manager and Adviser
Dennis King
Dennis brings nearly 20 years of experience in student support, supplemental instruction, program development, management and supervision in public higher education. In addition to his student success leadership and administrative responsibilities, his journey as a practitioner in higher education is steeped in promoting academic excellence and ensuring equitable educational opportunities. As the adviser for College of Computing programs (Bachelor of IT, Master of IT, and Master of Data Science), Dennis will work to ensure that all CoC learners are provided quality advising services as they journey to reach their academic, personal, and professional goals.
Course Planning Resources
Before you begin course planning, it is essential to review and become familiar with our degree requirements. Here are some planning tools and tips to get you started:
